review_blob: Smells sweet and fruity. Looks nice bright lightly hazy orange color. Small white foam head. Taste good definitely has some biterness and a peppery tart citrus nodes.

I like this beer. The color is a deep carmel see through red. With a creamy head on pour. Scent wasnt my favorite but the taste and finish make up for it.The ginger and smoked malt are there but not overpowering. Nicely balanced very tasty.

Bottle pour black dark milk porter small quickly dispering head. Not much aroma slight smells of roasted malts. Clean and smooth taste nice texture slightly thick for a porter. Very good balance of roasted malts slight sweetness like chocolate milk ,toffee , carmel nodes and a slight hit of creamy crispy bitterness at the end. Very enjoyable...
beer_name: Odd Side Ales How Now Brown Cow

review_blob: Clear see through carmel red light brown color with small white head off bottle pour. Taste of carmel and nice balance between maltiness and sweetness. Not very hoppy or bitter. Crisp roasted taste on ending.

Bottle poured nice aroma flora sweet and strong. Nice hazy Orange color with decent foam head. Taste of grapefruit, pine has a nice bite. Along with earthy malty undertones. A nice balance of sweetness citrus in the beginning with some bitterness on the finish. Definitely notice the 9.7%. Would certainly drink again.
